00020 #include "util/Err.h"
00021 #include "util/Except.h"
00022 #include "util/Util.h"
00023 //
00024 
00025 class MyErrHandler : public ErrHandler {
00026 
00027 public:
00028   // Our broken error handler.
00029   void handleError(const std::string & msg) {
00030     Verbose::out(0, "Need to fix this error handler to abort. Message is: '" + msg + "'");
00031   }
00032   
00033 };
00034 
00035 int main(int argc, const char *argv[]) {
00036   Verbose::out(1, "Welcome to error handling demostration.");
00037   // use a throwing error handler.
00038   Err::setThrowStatus(true); 
00039   // push on a custom error handler
00040   MyErrHandler *handler = new MyErrHandler();
00041   Err::pushHandler(handler);
00042   Err::errAbort("Simulating first dummy error with custom error handler.");
00043 
00044   // remove custom error handler leaving throwing error handler.
00045   ErrHandler *errHand = Err::popHandler();
00046   delete errHand;
00047   try {
00048     Err::errAbort("Simulating first dummy error with default throwing error handler.");
00049   }
00050   catch(Except &e) {
00051     Verbose::out(1, "Caught exception: '" + ToStr(e.what()) + "'");
00052   }
00053   // add a handler that just exit(1) at end of message.
00054   Err::setThrowStatus(false);
00055   Err::errAbort("Simulating first dummy error with default exit(1) error handler.");
00056   return 0;
00057 }
